channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: A hydrothermal explosion sends Yellowstone visitors running
item.description: A video posted on Facebook showed park visitors running from a massive black cloud as it rose. Hydrothermal explosions happen when water suddenly turns into steam underground.
item.content:encoded:
A video posted on Facebook showed park visitors running from a massive black cloud as it rose. Hydrothermal explosions happen when water suddenly turns into steam underground.

(Image credit: National Park Service)
item.dc:creator: James Doubek

item.title: Report finds Army leadership failures leading up to Maine bowling alley mass shooting
item.description: The long-awaited report from the Army about how leaders handled shooter Robert Card in the months leading up to the Lewiston, Maine mass shootings will be released on Monday.
item.content:encoded: The long-awaited report from the Army about how leaders handled shooter Robert Card in the months leading up to the Lewiston, Maine mass shootings will be released on Monday.
item.dc:creator: Kevin Miller

item.title: Longtime running buddies are poised to compete in the streets of Paris
item.description: NPR's Juana Summers talks with US men's marathoners Conner Mantz and Clayton Young about the challenges of the Paris marathon, and their longtime friendship on and off the running course.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Juana Summers talks with US men's marathoners Conner Mantz and Clayton Young about the challenges of the Paris marathon, and their longtime friendship on and off the running course.
item.dc:creator: Vincent Acovino

item.title: It’s not a B movie: scientists say sharks are ingesting cocaine in drug-tainted water
item.description: Illegal narcotics may be damaging marine wildlife. Sharks are swimming in drug tainted waters, ingesting cocaine according to scientists in Brazil.
item.content:encoded: Illegal narcotics may be damaging marine wildlife. Sharks are swimming in drug tainted waters, ingesting cocaine according to scientists in Brazil.
item.dc:creator: John Otis

item.title: Netanyahu is addressing Congress tomorrow. Here's what to expect from Democrats
item.description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu is addressing Congress Wednesday in a speech he hopes will bolster his standing. Democrats have said there will be boycotts from some members.
item.content:encoded: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu is addressing Congress Wednesday in a speech he hopes will bolster his standing. Democrats have said there will be boycotts from some members.
item.dc:creator: Barbara Sprunt

item.title: Delta's flight delays and cancellations prompt Dept. of Transportation investigation
item.description: In a statement to NPR, Delta acknowledged the Department of Transportation’s notice and said the airline is "fully cooperating" with the investigation.
item.content:encoded:
In a statement to NPR, Delta acknowledged the Department of Transportation’s notice and said the airline is "fully cooperating" with the investigation.

(Image credit: Michael Dwyer)
item.dc:creator: Jonathan Franklin

item.title: Former Secret Service head on the agency's controversy following the rally shooting
item.description: NPR's Ailsa Chang talks with Ralph Basham, the director of the Secret Service during the George W. Bush administration, about Secret Service director Kimberly Cheatle's decision to resign.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Ailsa Chang talks with Ralph Basham, the director of the Secret Service during the George W. Bush administration, about Secret Service director Kimberly Cheatle's decision to resign.
item.dc:creator: Tyler Bartlam

item.title: Kamala Harris has a history of breaking barriers. How might that inform her campaign?
item.description: Harris’s entire career is a list of jobs that nobody who looks quite like her had held before, including California’s attorney general, senator and vice president of the United States.
item.content:encoded: Harris’s entire career is a list of jobs that nobody who looks quite like her had held before, including California’s attorney general, senator and vice president of the United States.
item.dc:creator: Asma Khalid

item.title: VP Kamala Harris kicks off first rally of presidential campaign in Wisconsin
item.description: In Wisconsin, Vice President Kamala Harris kicked off the first rally of her presidential campaign, since becoming the frontrunner in the race to become the Democratic nominee.
item.content:encoded: In Wisconsin, Vice President Kamala Harris kicked off the first rally of her presidential campaign, since becoming the frontrunner in the race to become the Democratic nominee.
item.dc:creator: Scott Shafer

item.title: British Olympian pulls out of Paris after 'error of judgment' sparks investigation
item.description: Less than a week before she was set to compete in the Paris Games, the six-time Olympic medalist in dressage was suspended from competition for her actions depicted in a video from four years ago.
item.content:encoded:
Less than a week before she was set to compete in the Paris Games, the six-time Olympic medalist in dressage was suspended from competition for her actions depicted in a video from four years ago.

(Image credit: David Goldman)
item.dc:creator: Emma Bowman
